page.title: 09The Media in Ref.02760084
page.content: Television and Radio are of great importance in this area as most inhab itants would have to collect newspap_ ers from Moretonhampstead.Newspapers are carried by bus to Doccombe where they are collected and delivered by a resident. There is a fivepence daily delivery charge.The cost of the news_ paper varies from 25 pence for a daily paper to 40 pence for a Sunday paper. Radio is popular.News,weather,plays and music can be listened to whilst continuing with daily activities.Farm ers receive useful information,and sets are easily transported.National, Independent,Local and some European stations can be clearly heard. Almost every home has a Television receiver.The terrain is hilly but the reception is good.Two National and two Independent channels are available.
